column1: Topic title:  Pakatan Harapan consistent on cutting GST to zero

column8: text

http://www.malaysiakini.com/news/380268‘Pakatan Harapan consistent on cutting GST to zero’25 April 2017PKR vice-president Nurul Izzah Anwar has clarified that Pakatan Harapan is consistent on its stance on the Goods and Services Tax (GST), by committing to impose zero percent GST if the coalition comes to power.This comes after a New Straits Times (NST) headline stating that Harapan will not abolish the tax.“In other words, reducing the GST rate to zero percent will effectively negate the impact of GST when Pakatan Harapan is given the mandate to govern.For the rest of this story and more, subscribe for only RM150 a year (full news access)or RM420 a year (full news + full archive access). If you're already a subscriber, please sign in.
